Description: Unique identifier assigned to each participant.
Age of the participant at the time of the experiment.
Self-reported or observed gender identity of the participant.
Highest completed education level of the participant.
Any reported or documented clinical conditions relevant to cognitive, language, or psychological functioning.
Participant's native or first-acquired language.
Languages learned after the first language, optionally with proficiency level.
Participant's self-reported nationality.
Participant's country of birth.
Participant's current country of residence.
Unique identifier for a single trial within a session or condition.
Presentation order within the session (0-indexed). The order in which the participant saw this trial.
Experimental list number (1-8). Items were distributed across 8 lists.
Identifier for the experimental phase or block a trial belongs to (e.g., practice, test, recall).
Binary indicator of whether the participant's response was correct.
Experimental condition assigned to the trial.
The linguistic or visual stimulus presented to the participant in a given trial.
The target word that participants rated for expectedness (from https://doi.org/10.3758/s13428-024-02379-9)
Participant's response
Cleaned / corrected response (spelling normalized).
First association response (for association tasks)
Second association response (for association tasks)
Xth association response (for association tasks)
Participant's 'best' choice string (from https://doi.org/10.1037/rev0000392)
Participant's 'worst' choice string (from https://doi.org/10.1037/rev0000392)
Time taken by the participant to respond, in milliseconds.
Time from text-box onset to first typed key (ms).
Filename or identifier for the presented image.
Object identifier (concept depicted by the image).
Percentage of participants giving the modal name for the image (0-100).
Entropy of the name distribution for the image (bits).
H-statistic normalised for sample-size differences.
Count of responses coded 'unknown' per O'Sullivan coding scheme.
Count of idiosyncratic (singleton) responses per O'Sullivan coding scheme.
Count of non-object / unrelated responses per Oâ€™Sullivan coding scheme.
Flag/score indicating physical dissimilarity of image variants.
Whether the object is a natural kind (true/false).
Whether the response equals the modal name for that image.
Frequency (e.g. Zipf) of the modal response word.
Frequency of the individual response word.
Number of characters in modal name.
Number of characters in individual response.
Production frequency (how many participants produced the response).
Production freq after outlier removal.
Flag marking invalid responses (missing/non-word/timed-out).
Flag marking RT outliers removed from RT analyses.
Flag if word not found in SUBTLEX-UK frequency resource.
